009package Ch13_ColorImages;
010
011import java.awt.image.ColorModel;
012import java.awt.image.IndexColorModel;
013
014import ij.IJ;
015import ij.ImagePlus;
016import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
017import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * ImageJ plugin, increases the brightness of an indexed color image by 10 units
022 * (each color component). See Sec. 13.1 (Prog. 13.3) of [1] for details. Note
023 * that only the color model (RGB lookup table) of the image is changed while the
024 * actual pixel values are not modified.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
028 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 *
033 */
034public class Brighten_Index_Image implements PlugInFilter {
035        
036        private static int INCREASE = 10;       // increase by 10 units
037        
038        @Override
039        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
040                return DOES_8G + DOES_8C;       // this plugin works on indexed color images 
041        }
042
043        @Override
044        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
045                ColorModel cm =  ip.getColorModel();
046//              IJ.log("Color Model=" + cm + " " + ip.isColorLut());
047                
048                if (!(cm instanceof IndexColorModel)) {
049                        IJ.error("Color model not of type IndexedColorModel");
050                        return;
051                }
052                IndexColorModel icm = (IndexColorModel) cm; 
053                
054                int pixBits = icm.getPixelSize(); 
055                int nColors = icm.getMapSize(); 
056                
057                //retrieve the current lookup tables (maps) for R,G,B
058                byte[] rMap = new byte[nColors]; 
059                byte[] gMap = new byte[nColors]; 
060                byte[] bMap = new byte[nColors];
061                
062                icm.getReds(rMap);  
063                icm.getGreens(gMap);
064                icm.getBlues(bMap);  
065                
066                // modify the lookup tables     
067                for (int idx = 0; idx < nColors; idx++){ 
068                        int r = 0xff & rMap[idx];       //mask to treat as unsigned byte 
069                        int g = 0xff & gMap[idx];
070                        int b = 0xff & bMap[idx];   
071                        rMap[idx] = (byte) Math.min(r + INCREASE, 255); 
072                        gMap[idx] = (byte) Math.min(g + INCREASE, 255);
073                        bMap[idx] = (byte) Math.min(b + INCREASE, 255);
074                }
075                
076                //create a new color model and apply to the image
077                IndexColorModel icm2 = new IndexColorModel(pixBits, nColors, rMap, gMap, bMap);  
078                ip.setColorModel(icm2);
079        }
080
081}
082
